intro: Cyanea solenocalyx var. schizocalyx, commonly known as the Hawaiian sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows along coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Hawaii. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. This species is also known for its ability to thrive in sandy soils and its role in local ecosystems.
